i1.name: Love Tap
description: {{sbc|Innate:}} '''Miss Fortune's''' next basic attack against an enemy that was not the target of her previous basic attack will deal {{as|{{pp|key=%|50 to 100 for 6|1;4;7 to 13|formula=50% + 10% every 3 levels up to 7, then + 10% every 2 levels up to 13}} AD}} {{as|'''bonus''' physical damage}}, halved to {{as|{{pp|key=%|50/2 to 100/2 for 6|1;4;7 to 13|formula=25% + 5% every 3 levels up to 7, then + 5% every 2 levels up to 13}} AD}} against {{tip|minion|minions}}.
i1.descriptionHtml: Innate: Miss Fortune's next basic attack against an enemy that was not the target of her previous basic attack will deal 1;4;7 to 13 ‒ undefined AD bonus physical damage, halved to 1;4;7 to 13 ‒ undefined AD against minions.
i1.notes:
* With {{ii|Runaan's Hurricane}}, ''Love Tap'' only applies to the primary target.
* ''Love Tap'' will apply to {{tip|turret|turrets}}.
* The bonus damage applies {{sti|life steal|link=true}}.

q1.name: Double Up
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Miss Fortune''' fires a shot at the target enemy that deals {{as|physical damage}} upon its arrival, which then bounces to hit another enemy behind it. The shot applies {{tip|on-hit}} effects at 100% effectiveness to both enemies hit, and applies {{tip|on-attack}} effects to the first enemy hit.
''Double Up's'' bounce prioritizes units directly behind the primary target.
''Double Up's'' bounce is affected by {{tip|critical strike}} modifiers. If ''Double Up'' kills its primary target, the bounce is guaranteed to {{tip|critically strike}}.
''The shot bounces to the enemy regardless of having {{tip|sight}} of them or not.''
q1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Miss Fortune fires a shot at the target enemy that deals physical damage upon its arrival, which then bounces to hit another enemy behind it. The shot applies on-hit effects at 100% effectiveness to both enemies hit, and applies on-attack effects to the first enemy hit.
Double Up's bounce prioritizes units directly behind the primary target.
Double Up's bounce is affected by critical strike modifiers. If Double Up kills its primary target, the bounce is guaranteed to critically strike.
The shot bounces to the enemy regardless of having sight of them or not.
q1.notes:
* ''Double Up'' deals {{tip|basic damage}} to both targets, but also triggers spell effects by dealing an additional 0 {{tip|spell damage}}.
* {{tip|Spell shield|Spell shields}} can be used by either target. If it is on the primary target, the spell shield will not prevent the shot from bouncing.
* The second shot follows a priority order on targets within 500 units of the primary one:
*# Enemy or neutral units within a 20º cone.
*# Enemy or neutral units within a 40º cone.
*# Enemy or neutral units within a 110º cone.
*# Enemy or neutral units within {{tt|150|Estimated}} units in a 160º cone.
* ''Double Up's'' cast range adjusts based on '''Miss Fortune's''' {{sti|attack range}}, which can be increased by items such as {{ii|Rapid Firecannon}}.
* The damage of a {{tip|critical strike|critically striking}} second shot is {{ap|20*1.75 to 100*1.75}} {{as|(+ 175% AD)}} {{as|(+ 61.25% AP)}} {{as|physical damage}}, increased to {{ap|20*2.1 to 100*2.1}} {{as|(+ 210% AD)}} {{as|(+ 73.5% AP)}} {{as|physical damage}} by {{iis|Infinity Edge}} bonus critical damage.
* If there is no secondary target, the shot will not bounce and the dud will instead fall to the ground.
** The dud lands on the ground 176 units behind the primary target and has a missile speed of 400 on its journey there.

effects.str: • Physical Damage: (+ 100% AD) (+ 35% AP)

e1.name: Make It Rain
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Miss Fortune''' rains down hundreds of bullets onto the target location for 2 seconds, granting {{tip|sight}} of the area and dealing {{as|magic damage}} to all enemies within every {{fd|0.25}} seconds and {{tip|slow|slowing}} them.
e1.descriptionHtml: Active: Miss Fortune rains down hundreds of bullets onto the target location for 2 seconds, granting sight of the area and dealing magic damage to all enemies within every 0.25 seconds and slowing them.

effects.str:
• Magic Damage Per Tick: (+ 10% AP)
  • Maximum Magic Damage: (+ % AP)

  • Slow: %

r1.name: Bullet Time
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Miss Fortune''' {{tip|channel|channels}} for up to 3 seconds, firing several waves of bullets in a spread of 6 projectiles per wave in the target direction, with each wave dealing {{as|75% AD}} {{as|(+ 20% AP)}} {{as|physical damage}} to enemies hit.
Each wave can {{tip|critical strike|critically strike}}, dealing {{as|{{critical damage|20}} '''bonus''' physical damage}}.
r1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Miss Fortune channels for up to 3 seconds, firing several waves of bullets in a spread of 6 projectiles per wave in the target direction, with each wave dealing 75% AD (+ 20% AP) physical damage to enemies hit.
Each wave can critically strike, dealing (+ IE 25%) bonus physical damage.
leveling: {{st|Total Waves|{{ap|12 to 16}}|Minimum Total Physical Damage|{{as|{{ap|75*12 to 75*16}}% AD}} {{as|(+ {{ap|20*12 to 20*16}}% AP)}}}} {{st|Wave Interval Time| {{ap|2.85/(12 to 16)|round=4}}}}
r1.notes:
* The damage dealt by each wave of ''Bullet Time'' is calculated when the wave reaches the target.
* Targets cannot be damaged by more than one projectile per wave.
* The bullet streams that each fire 1 projectile per wave are spead by 6{{degree}} between one another, aiming towards the angles +-3/9/15{{degree}} from '''Miss Fortune's''' facing direction.
* ''Bullet time'' picks 6 locations on the ground 500 units from '''Miss Fortune''' (with the aforementioned angles) at the start of the channel and fires a bullet stream towards each.
** If '''Miss Fortune''' is {{ii|Galeforce|moved}} or {{ai|Realm Warp|Ryze|teleported}} to a new location, these locations will '''not''' update; the cone will fire towards Miss Fortune's original position, thinning down or spreading out based on distance from the group of locations.
* ''Bullet time'' fires the first wave at {{rutngt|0.05}}, and the last at {{rutngt|2.9}}. Times between waves are equally spread between these values.
** '''Miss Fortune''' may cancel the last ~{{fd|0.1}} seconds of channel time at no loss of effect.
* The following table refers for interactions while '''Miss Fortune''' is {{tip|channel|channeling}}:
{{ct|channel|attack=interrupts|cast=interrupts|move=interrupts|items=interrupts,true,,false|consume=true|spells=true,interrupts,interrupts,interrupts,interrupts}}
